title: BBC Local Live: Nottinghamshire on Wednesday 25 January 2017 - BBC News

news , sport , travel and weather updates resume at 08:00 on thursday .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: that 's all from local live today .
join us again tomorrow .

documents.title: east midlands weather update : cloud increasing
text: cloud will increase from the south east through the afternoon .
it 'll stay cloudy overnight with some isolated drizzle or light snow flurries and the risk of ice on some untreated surfaces in places .
author: Lucy Martin
BBC Weather

documents.title: latest headlines for nottinghamshire
text: latest headlines for nottinghamshire
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: gang planned £ 1.9m rolling tobacco scam
text: hardy 's gang was in the process of setting up an illegal counterfeit tobacco factory , which would have netted them millions of pounds in unpaid duty , when they were raided in 2008 .

at a farm in leicestershire , officers discovered more than 16 tonnes of raw leaf tobacco which would have been manufactured into hand-rolling tobacco , potentially avoiding an estimated £ 1.9 million .
bulgarian anti-organised crime officers raided premises linked to the scam .
hardy was arrested in november in cape town and held in a prison there until he was extradited to heathrow this morning .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'one of uk 's most wanted fugitives ' jailed
text: a west bridgford man , who was one of the uk 's most wanted tax fugitives , has been jailed for three years and three months for his role in a £ 1.9m plot to manufacture illicit tobacco on a commercial scale .
wayne hardy , 56 , fled to cape town in 2010 before he was sentenced to three years and three months in his absence .
he was extradited from south africa to face trial at ipswich crown court today , where he was found guilty and three months were added to his tariff .
hardy 's the fifth and final member of the gang to go to prison .
four others were jailed in 2011 for their part in the scam .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: your trent bridge
text: it 's been a crisp , clear day out there - perfect for photos .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: clough on forest rumours : 'it 's a logical link '
text: burton albion manager nigel clough has put the record straight on over talk he could be replacing philippe montanier at nottingham forest .
`` i spent 18 years at that club [ forest ] , i 've spent 11 here so it 's a logical link for some people , '' he said .
author: BBC Derby Sport

documents.title: pm agrees to support family
text: in response , theresa may said she was happy to seriously look at the case and raise the issue with the foreign office .
disappointed the pm did n't agree to meet chris & lydia but glad of an opportunity to support them # justice4jamie
glad you spoke up in parliament earlier on today !
if there 's one @ twitterid mp who still has my backing , its definitely you !
author: Tony Roe
BBC East Midlands political editor

documents.title: mp asks for help for greece death family
text: earlier at pmqs , nottingham south mp lillian greenwood asked the prime minister for help for a family whose nine-year-old son was killed by the rider of a speeding motorbike in greece .
jamie leek , from clifton , was killed crossing a road in zakynthos in 2012 .
the motorbike rider remains free after appealing his sentence for involuntary homicide but the family are seeking justice .
author: Tony Roe
BBC East Midlands political editor

documents.title: canal body 'not yet formally identified '
text: police have just told me they 're yet to formally identify the man 's body found in the canal off carrington street this morning .
officers are still investigating the circumstances of the death .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: dashcam footage used to jail burglars
text: two men , who have been jailed today for burgling an elderly couple 's home in mansfield , were caught using dashcam footage from a passing driver .
john shaw , 36 , of sutton-in-ashfield , and sefton brown , 37 , formerly of kirkby-in-ashfield , stole a wallet from the couple 's chesterfield road south home in july last year .

leicester crown court heard a passing motorist had recorded the pair acting sus in the couple 's front garden and continued to film them rifling through the wallet before discarding photos from it in a bin .
shaw was jailed for four years and six months after being found guilty of burglary .
brown , who admitted burglary , was jailed for three years and eight months .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: broxtowe mp reacts to brexit white paper
text: broxtowe mp anna soubry has been giving her thoughts on the news that the government will set out its brexit plans in a formal policy document .
the pm has listened & has agreed to # whitepaper on # brexit - it 's part of building a consensus & healing # brexit wounds
although i 'm not a brexit and agree with you on most , where 's the evidence we 're wounded or the process of being wounded ?
if you need to ask the question you are either not in the uk or nelson blind .
elaborate ?
here 's the deal : there 's no conciliatory middle ground .
i do n't value or respect the views of leave voters .
that attitude is what lost you the ref .
you will have to get used to it one day for your own sake .
i doubt it .
i do , however , want leavers to get every ounce of hard brexit .
every job loss is icing
what would that then do for you ?
i 'll be immensely gratified to have been wholly correct .
i will never stop pointing it out .
if brexit goes ahead there is a huge number of uk population that will not forgive this government .
i want to remain eu citizen
if it does n't go ahead there is a larger number of the uk population that will not forgive the government ! !
ah , the 17million ?
last check the uk population 65million .
48million you forgot about do n't want brexit !
ha ha .
@ twitterid there is no `` healing '' brexit .
the sides are mutually exclusive .
compromise is always possible .
by giving in to the uk 's far right and deeply unintelligent , yes .
i do n't like may 's `` plan '' but something acceptable could result from the negotiations .
personally , i 'm not interested in less than fully abandoning the idea - which wo n't happen .
i would settle for something like the arrangements for countries such as norway and switzerland .
i honestly think the damage is done anyway .
uk has revealed itself to have an unpleasant far-right tone
you 've revealed yourself to be deeply unpleasant & bigoted more obviously then any far-right tone .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'friar tuck ' shares sherwood forest fracking fears
text: the actor who played friar tuck in the tv series robin of sherwood is backing a campaign to stop fracking from taking place in sherwood forest .
phil rose has joined residents and environmentalists to oppose plans to inspect part of the ancient forest to see if there is potential for fracking .
some 275,000 people have added their names to two petitions against the proposals .
author: Rebecca Dickson
Reporter, BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: 'large smoke plume '
text: crews are using breathing apparatus and jets to extinguish the fire - which is causing a large smoke plume heading towards # langold .

text: firefighters from # worksop and # retford are currently tackling a blaze involving two coaches well alight on # claylandsavenue , worksop .

text: in a statement , the ex-forest striker said he has `` decided to withdraw from any involvement in this process '' .

`` i 'm not convinced change will happen quickly or thoroughly enough under fawaz ownership of the club , as i believe there is a clique around him that are more interested in serving their own interests rather than those of the club , '' he said .

documents.title: man , 90 , in court over historic sex offences
text: a 90-year-old man has gone on trial accused of historical sex crimes at an approved school in nottinghamshire .
dennis young denies committing a string of offences against a boy he was teaching at skegby hall , near mansfield .
nottingham crown court 's been told that the alleged offences took place almost 60 years ago , when the pupil was 10 years old .
author: Jeremy Ball
Social affairs correspondent, BBC East Midlands Today

documents.title: snowdonia fall man 'died of natural causes '
text: there will be no inquest into mr parnell 's death as he died of natural causes , it has been confirmed .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man who died after snowdonia fall named
text: a 52-year-old man who died after a fall while walking in snowdonia has been named as neil parnell , from nottingham .
ogwen valley mountain rescue and raf kinloss were called to bristley ridge between tryfan and glyder fach just before 15:00 yesterday , north wales police said .
mr parnell was airlifted to ysbyty gwynedd in bangor , where he was later pronounced dead .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: nottingham south mp to quiz pm
text: coming up at 12:00 on prime minister 's questions , nottingham south 's labour mp lillian greenwood has a question on the order paper
ca n't remember the last time this happened ... # redsuitday

prices of bread ?
or how do you break the contract with gps and expect a continued service ?
author: Tony Roe

documents.title: what does move mean for ground ?
text: it means the trust would have to be involved in any sale of the city ground .
the trust would be given an opportunity to bid to buy the ground and given six months to raise funds .
trust members would also have to be on board with any decision to buy the club .
author: David Jackson
BBC Radio Nottingham Sport

documents.title: city ground could be listed as 'community asset '
text: the nottingham forest supporters ' trust has applied to register the city ground as an `` asset of community value '' .
nottingham city council has also pledged that the land will never be sold .
more to follow .
author: David Jackson
BBC Radio Nottingham Sport

documents.title: mechanic jailed for £ 450k 'chop shop '
text: parts from cars stolen in nottingham were found at a `` chop shop '' in the west midlands , a court has heard .
mechanic eamonn o'malley , 59 , was jailed for three years and seven months for receiving stolen goods at wolverhampton crown court on friday .
police were alerted to his car yard in tipton by a tracking device from a stolen bmw .
at least 22 stolen vehicles with a combined value of £ 448,000 had passed through the yard from across the west midlands , manchester , london , stoke-on-trent and nottingham , police said .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: your bennerley viaduct
text: the fog is beginning to lift here in nottingham , but this was the scene at the old railway viaduct this morning
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: man arrested over 'arson ' at former cinema
text: a teenager has been arrested in connection with a suspected arson attack at a former cinema .
firefighters and police were called to reports of a fire at the old galaxy cinema on derby road , long eaton around 22:30 last night .
the 18-year-old , who lives in long eaton , was arrested in the early hours of this morning and will be questioned later today .
author: Khia Lewis-Todd
BBC Local Live

documents.title: lady pies ' williams makes england appearance
text: well played rachel williams , of notts county ladies , on her first england appearance since 2013 against sweden .
williams - who also works as a plasterer - dominated the midfield , winning challenges all over the pitch .
author: BBC Nottingham Sport

documents.title: breakingcarrington street : man 's body found in canal
text: police have now confirmed a man 's body was found in a canal off carrington street this morning .
they said they were called at 07:36 .
the man was pronounced dead at the scene and officers are investigating the circumstances of his death .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: horse dumpings 'just tip of iceberg '
text: it 's not been a nice subject to talk about but you 'll have probably heard about a spate of horses being dumped in various places across the east midlands recently .
according to a local charity , the recent dumpings , including in calverton earlier this month ( are just the `` tip of the iceberg '' .
janice dixon , a vet from help for horses , said mandatory microchips were not being used and people were scared to report culprits .
she said she knew of seven cases in the past three months in the east midlands .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel : m1 lane closed
text: an accident and the fog has closed one lane of the m1 northbound between junctions 28 and 29 .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: travel : bus delays remain
text: all services are now able to stop at nottingham station again .
delays of 25+mins remain .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: collymore to propose 'sporting director ' role
text: former nottingham forest striker stan collymore said he wants a role at the club `` to prove what he can do '' .
collymore said he 's been asked to put into writing a proposal to create a new role as `` sporting director '' .
he met with owner fawaz al-hasawi in london last night .
meanwhile , forest are at leeds in the championship tonight without injured defender matt mills .
author: BBC Nottingham Sport

documents.title: carrington street 'reopening '
text: a handful of police remain at the scene but we still do n't know exactly what 's happening .
traffic was stopped from exiting and entering carrington street , causing a lot of disruption to people trying to get to work .
buses and cars are now being allowed back on to the street and , in the last five minutes , i have seen five or six cars enter without a problem .
